name: Path N NET Colon
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a regional lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 12 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0. 

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in the distant metastasis.

**Note 3:**  Inferior mesenteric nodes are coded in distant metastasis for cecum, ascending colon, transverse colon, and hepatic flexure. Superior mesenteric nodes are coded in distant metastasis for all colon sites.

** Note 4:** Regional lymph nodes for colon
 
**All colon sites** 

    Colic [NOS] 
    Epicolic (adjacent to bowel wall) 
    Mesocolic [NOS] 
    Mesenteric [NOS]
    Paracolic/pericolic

**Cecum (C180)** 

    Anterior (prececal), 
    Cecal [NOS]
    Ileocolic
    Periappendiceal
    Posterior (retrocecal)
    Right colic 

**Ascending colon (C182)** 

    Ileocolic
    Middle colic
    Right colic

**Hepatic flexure (C183)** 

    Middle colic 
    Right colic

**Transverse colon (C184)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Middle colic 
    Right colic

**Splenic flexure (C185)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Middle colic

**Descending colon (C186)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Sigmoid 

**Sigmoid colon (C187)** 

    Inferior mesenteric 
    Left colic 
    Rectosigmoid 
    Sigmoid 
    Sigmoidal (sigmoid mesenteric) 
    Superior hemorrhoidal 
    Superior rectal
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes is done but involvement of regional nodes not stated
Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes is done but involvement of regional nodes not documented in patient record

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1

Pathologic N is not defined for this site/histology
In situ (no Tis defined)

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of the primary
